comment: main issue is style of writing instructions, grammar is not easy to understand i had to run them through chat to get what to i needed to do. has lockdown for vocab quizzes & tests but not too hard. lectures were 1hr+ (one of them was 2.5) which is CRAZY on top of a chapter of textbook/wk. also the study guides were not very similar to the tests
Awful about communication and responding to emails. The resources he provided were almost never accessible.

Don't take him for an **online** class, as I have not been able to reach him all semester, and have had many problems with modules not working, or not being clear in instructions, which for an online class is very frustrating. All of his material is from another prof. There isn't much work, but it is unclear what's on tests, which is 50% of grade.

Hes an amazing professor, however you have to buy a $92 E Book that you only have access to for 180 days and the book is written by him.... sounds like hes just wanting to push his own book to get sales. 

He could easily lower the price as $92 for an E BOOK is crazy. Esp because you can only access it for 180 days.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: This class was fairly easy but it was a heavy workload and attendance was required as it was 20% of your grade. The classes were long but useful. There were at least 40-100 pages to read each week and a discussion post that had to be a page length. He was very lenient as everything just had to be due by the end of the semester.

His lectures are really just listening to him talk about stuff for hours that isn't directly related to the readings you have to do each week. It's a ridiculous amount of reading if I'm honest just to do the weekly assignments, but there aren't any quizzes or tests so as long as you do the readings and one-page paper each week, you'll be fine.

The class was good. The teacher was very nice and understanding. The only thing is that there was not really any teaching, rather we had to teach ourselves and read the book. His prerecorded lectures did help though. At the end of the class he adds in points from old test. One discussion and one reply each week. Overall, do your work and read!!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He made this class fun and exciting my grade (B) was from little effort, so an A is easy to get in this class. So why not get an easy A and actually learn at the same time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Took online. Did a discussion post every two weeks over whatever I wanted to talk about. 2 quizzes, midterm, final. Thats it. Textbook mandatory especially if you dont watch the online lectures. Made an A with minimal effort.

This was an amazing class! If you want to be educated on how to not be racist and what white privilege entails take this class! If you're racist don't take this class, you will probably get your panties in a bunch. Great discussions, one assignment is to share things on facebook, no tests, and 1-2 page weekly paper not due until end of semester.
He is very understanding, curves his quizzes and tests... good professor overall!

Best professor I have taken at KSU. teaches the real issues that are taboo to talk about. So knowledgeable about so many topics. Very openminded and cares about everyone's input. Love the class format of open conversation about topics. Best professor ive taken at KSU and im petitioning to graduate, you will learn So much. should be required class.
Race & Ethnicity should be a required course. I have never learned (and enjoyed learning) so much! Dr. Benjamin is a phenomenal professor! Take his class!

Great teacher! If you read the material and participate you will be fine. Make sure you READ & be willing to open your mind to learn. Great class and an exceptional teacher. DONT BE A MOUSE, speak up and ask questions!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Benjamin is an excellent professor in a non-traditional way, which makes it easier to engage in a discussion based setting. This course is not to constrain one's mind to a constructional way of thinking, but to expand your knowledge and make you question everything. Take his course and be prepared to have your mind blown.

Professor Benjamin is pretty awesome! His class is extremely eye opening and inspirational. The class is completely group discussion and he makes sure to let everyone speak. He assigns a 10 pager but you have the option of doing a group project, so he's really reasonable and listens. I would definitely take him again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Benjamin's lectures are very well prepared and thought out. He is very thorough and passionate about what he teaches. A debate with Dr. Benjamin is something you will never forget!

I absolutely adore this professor! He's so well rounded in his knowledge of world history and current affairs, he's a walking encyclopedia! You'll enjoy his class and be amazed at how laid back and easy going he is. 20% class participation, 40% FB group participation. 40% 1 written paper. That's it! No busy work or tests just show up & participate!

Amazing teacher! I feel EVERY BODY should take this class, it will change your perspectives on almost everything! He is very passionate and knowledgeable about the subject of race and injustices. There weren't any quizzes or tests, just participation grades and a (group) paper due at the end of the semester)

Dr. Benjamin is an amazing person who loves what he does. If you want to learn or dig deeper into this subject, he will definitely take it there. The grading was a little sketchy to understand, but I think he gives the grade you deserve in the end. He knows a lot of information, so get ready to listen and change your way of thinking after the sem

Class goes the full length. It's a life changing take on race and ethnicity. Great discussions. The readings are nice but not req'd. No textbook! 40% Facebook discussion requiring 5 weekly posts, 20% attendance, 40% research paper. 10-12 pages, it can be a group project but beware - I had to pull dead weight. If you try on the paper he gives an A.

Boy oh' boy, where do I start? This man changed my view on life and the world, he is knowledgeable on literally every single thing that pertains to this history of this country, I want to go in depth very badly, but this box will tame me. BEST PROFESSOR IN THE SOCIAL SCIENCE BUILDING HANDS DOWN!!!! A must take, I hated reading, he made me love it.
He's AWESOME!!!!! You have to really try to fail his class.

I have had the privilege of having Dr. Bfor  2 classes in my first semester. This sociology class was one of two where his knowledge of the material is so far, un matched. The only suggestion I have for any student preparing to take one of dr B's classes is to address any questions and or concerns in person. He is a BUSY man!

This class was based on discussions of how the world views African Americans. He requires students to buy a $ 120 book  and read all the stories and summarize them by the end of the  semester. The book was not easy to read. You will have to talk or your grade will suffer. Doc Benjamin taught me valuable life lessons that I will never forget.

I have been at KSU for 6 years and he is one of the best professors I have had. He is passionate and super smart. I had him for summer semester (3 hour class) and time would fly in his class. You will learn so much and appreciate having taken his class. No textbooks, or tests. Not easy but you wont regret it.Great professor!!!

Awesome professor and class! No exams or quizzes. Just short readings every week that have to be summarized, a newspaper article collection, participation, and a final 8 page paper on a topic of your choice. You will learn so much in this class. Don't get behind on the readings or you will suffer in the end.

Dr. Benjamin is the best professor I think anyone could have. You cannot graduate from KSU without taking one of his classes. He is very passionate about what he believes in, and he is extremely intelligent. He has completely changed the way I look at life.
Completely useless class. I felt like I was being indoctrinated in activism the entire class.  Avoid at any cost, unless you have to take him.  If you do, make sure and talk about rap music.
Somewhat inconsistent and disorganized, but passionate and knowledge.
Very nice and easy going professor. However, he is an extremely unpredictable grader.

Dr.Benjamin is an awesome Professor and he is very knowledgeable and very intellegent.  What I loved about this class that he is so passionate about his teachings and he gets everyones attention.  He is not a boring professor and he did give us a lot of books to read. We have summaries do each week and much more. No final exam or midterm. Woohoo!

The man is a genius. After taking his class, I literally rethought my entire life and I am a better person because of it. I was going to transfer to GSU until i took him. The man lives the life he teaches about. A+ prof.

Just so u know this was a no textbook class in the past. However, now there are four textbooks, plenty of articles to read. Also, must typ up summaries of news events in relation to the middle east. This is not race and ethnicity the U.S. version. Must type up summaries on what you read in books and articles, attend two events, three other assign.

Too much, I mean three textbooks, keeping on what occurs everyday in the news, must attend events, type up summaries on your reaction to what occurs in relation to Africa,a grp presentation on a large portion of one of the textbooks, and articles. No tests or term papers. There are 1.5 to 2 page summaries on all assign. mentioned due every class.

I found this race and ethnicity class persuasive and somewhat misleading. The material he personally  creates for the class is offensive to certain ethnicities. And if you do not agree with his conceptual beliefs you may be in for a hard time in this class.

Jesse Benjamin is extremely intelligent and well rounded.  He is in tune with worldly issues and uses his classroom to expose students to global issues that also impact the US and how we think and perceive our lives.  Awesome class and awesome professor!  Going into this class I never imagined learning so much and feeling like I needed to learn so

This professor is very smart. He has a lot of knowledge about history and current events. He talks a lot and does not give students enough time to talk. BEST PROF EVER ON EARTH, i took him spring of 2010 he is great,very smart he knows what he is teaching unlike some other prof at ksu Dr. Benjamine is the best teacher please donot graduate without taking him. he is GREAT, GREATEST EVER ON EARTH

BEST PROF EVER ON EARTH, i took him fall of 2010 he is great,very smart he knows what he is teaching unlike some other prof at ksu Dr. Benjamine is the best teacher please donot graduate without taking him. he is GREAT, GREATEST EVER ON EARTH

Amazing course, changed my life as I will forever know it. Primarily discussion based every class. Didn't care about attendance nearly all semester until close to the end. Very lax and chill but serious about the issues at hand. No real work to do until the end when all his assignments are due, which were not hard but time consuming. No final exam.
Extreme radical views about race all over the world; not the norm. Very liberal professor, extremely intelligent.

He is an awesome professor. Very knowledgeable about history and how it interconnects with sociology and racial relations. His lectures will stimulate and ignite your mind. People who call him left wing hold  unsubstantiated personal opinions and feelings-based beliefs--they just don't think rationally. Read and you will do good.

Great teacher he is really teaching something different and opening your mind to something else. the ppl bothered by him being left wing are obviously closed minded he was accepting of all views. I never enjoyed going to class so much. I took him last yr and i'm taking him this yr too. GREAT TEACHER!!

This prof is extremely left wing and he seems to use his class more to push his personal political agenda than to have students see both sides of an issue. As long as you agree with his liberal views, he's fine. Disagree and  you will find life in that class a LOT more difficult.
I am yet to find a professor who's passionate about what he teaches. He's very knowledgeable,interesting, kind, and more than willing to help.
Take Mr. Benjamin if you are willing to learn. He is a great orator and is very passionate about the subject matter. He is very helpful and makes the class interesting.

Great instructor.  Very knowlegable and passonate about the subject matter.  No textbook but he supplies readings that are interesting.  Best prof thus far.  He doesn't require much from you except critical thinking and open-mindeness.  You will learn a lot from this class.  Regardless of major, take this class.
His class was boring but his teats were easy and self-explanatory.  Do a little reading in the book and come to class and you'll do fine.
He is by far the best teacher I have had at this institution by far.  It was an honor to be in his presence, a teacher with vast knowledge of the subject who was compassionate and knowledgeable.
Professor Benjamin is really awesome.  He wants you to learn as much as you can about the subject.  He is very passionate and knowledgable about the subject and it shows.
Best teacher I have ever had!

Class was conducted with the chairs in a circle facing the center of the room. Most of the class was discussion based, and many times strays from the topic of the chapter. That said, it was a very interesting and fun class with easy tests and an awesome professor. If you need to fill up an elective, do yourself a favor and take this class! (easy A)
